channel.title: yudel tweets
channel.description: A feed of recent tweets from yudel.

item.description:
@RB_Lemberg However, Paul Simeon’s effort at auto ethnography is one of his worst. https://t.co/eZifxm9e9I

@RB_Lemberg It’s a shame because it’s one of two horrible songs on an otherwise wonderful album.

item.description: @AmyGuterman @isaacdecastrog When I visited, Mexico City had four Jewish communities: One Ashkenazi, one Sefardi, one from Aleppo and one from Damascus.
item.source:markdown: @AmyGuterman @isaacdecastrog When I visited, Mexico City had four Jewish communities: One Ashkenazi, one Sefardi, one from Aleppo and one from Damascus.

item.description: @bayes_baes Having taken linear algebra 40 years ago, I was surprised and impressed to discover it’s now apparently pronounced “machine learning.”
item.source:markdown: @bayes_baes Having taken linear algebra 40 years ago, I was surprised and impressed to discover it’s now apparently pronounced “machine learning.”

item.description:
@MisfitTorah So, it’s a brilliant Haggadah that blew me away when I saw it in the museum space in the YU library 40 years ago. Definitely worth googling

@MisfitTorah Anyway, here’s the two page spread for בכל דור ודור which I bought as a framed print. The grey ovals are mirror leaf. https://t.co/w4jJNCS8sr

@MisfitTorah My report on his local visit. https://t.co/GmMHpJvEIQ

@MisfitTorah If you zoom in to the spread, you’ll note that the faces are from different centuries. בכל דור ודור, but also an awareness that his Haggadah is building off of thousands of years of Jewish iconography.
@MisfitTorah Are you familiar with the Moss Haggadah?
item.source:markdown: @MisfitTorah Are you familiar with the Moss Haggadah?

item.description: Hard to believe that a party led by fanatic followers of a religion which burnt cartloads of hand written Talmud volumes in central Paris would seek to persecute librarians, but here we are. https://t.co/gAj0DhZQCu
item.source:markdown: Hard to believe that a party led by fanatic followers of a religion which burnt cartloads of hand written Talmud volumes in central Paris would seek to persecute librarians, but here we are. https://t.co/gAj0DhZQCu

item.description: Your occasional reminder that some of Hannah Arendt’s essays are locked behind the @Commentary paywall. We need some brave young anti fascists to liberate them. https://t.co/6lDA9WmMsG

item.description: Interesting that @PJLibrary is expanding its original content — just a couple of years after a burst of new Jewish kidlit publishers that seem to be doing good work. I wonder what the story is here. https://t.co/84hZmdti7C

item.description:
When I was a kid, Isaac Asimov made science fiction publishing seem like the most exciting industry in the world.

I'm incredibly delighted to be able to pre-announce another volume of original Jewish science fiction, from the same editorial team that produced Other Covenants. https://t.co/Oq1fMlaPsn

A formal announcement and call for submissions will wait until 2023, but you can find the tentative title and subtitle on the Other Covenants Kickstarter page. https://t.co/VNbsvhGJMr

And despite the trials and tribulations that made their crazy dream of "an alternate Jewish history anthology" take far longer than expected, @AD_Lobel and @MarkShainblum are eager to create Jewish publishing history yet again. I couldn't be more excited to help them.
item.source:markdown:
When I was a kid, Isaac Asimov made science fiction publishing seem like the most exciting industry in the world.
I'm incredibly delighted to be able to pre-announce another volume of original Jewish science fiction, from the same editorial team that produced Other Covenants. https://t.co/Oq1fMlaPsn
A formal announcement and call for submissions will wait until 2023, but you can find the tentative title and subtitle on the Other Covenants Kickstarter page. https://t.co/VNbsvhGJMr
And despite the trials and tribulations that made their crazy dream of "an alternate Jewish history anthology" take far longer than expected, @AD_Lobel and @MarkShainblum are eager to create Jewish publishing history yet again. I couldn't be more excited to help them.

item.description: @EladNehorai Also, the precise opposite of the truth of the past century of American Jewish history. “Jewish pride” manifested in the 70s after the decline and canceling of antisemitism in the previous two decades.
item.source:markdown: @EladNehorai Also, the precise opposite of the truth of the past century of American Jewish history. “Jewish pride” manifested in the 70s after the decline and canceling of antisemitism in the previous two decades.
